comments.text: Good space for pulling over northbound. Ride in 2 mins with a cool person. Woot woot.
Going north to taupo. Good speed, space and sight just after the junction.
hitchhikers dream. got a lift to Wellington after 5 mins
Had to position myself well on the side of the road, but it's a busy place. Lots of cars and anyone going left is heading north. One of the better spots in Auckland for sure
Impossible Hitching out of Auckland? Not here, everybody turning left in the Motorwagen is going North, Tool mehr 5 minutes :) good luck
meet me at our spot this is THE spot for north out of dunedin don’t question it
I hitch from here often.  It's the best
Top of Pine Hill before speed change to 100km. Short area for cars to pull over after coming around corner. Got picked up in a minute.
Great Spot! People from Piha seem really chill so they will take you :)
If you're heading to Auckland from Piha this place is perfect: they can see you from a fair distance, there's room to stop and almost everyone goes back to Auckland from here. Less than 15 min.
Great spot to go to Abel Tasman
nice one
Big area to pull over, good visibility, slow traffic. This is a good spot for lifts to taupo and is the biggest busiest road available, yet perfectly hitchable.
Slow speeds and plenty of space!
Ask people stopped at the traffic lights. We got a ride heading south in 30 seconds from the 3rd car stopped at the lights
Waited only a few minutes for a lift direct to the centre of Wellington. Plenty of room for cars to pull over.
Great for getting to Wellington.
Wandering down the road early in morning. Because super early to catch the handful of campers going down the mountain. First car stopped hell yeah!!!!!
Wander along the road. Loads of space, loads of visibility. After a few rejections I got a ride towards taranaki!!

Space to pullover on the roadside... lots of offers to tamapara and that side road, however none to new Plymouth. Eventually to the ride and hitchiked the lost world highway to Stratford which took eternity.
You can take the bus from the centre till this point. Then you can hitchike on to the great tent campsite in Huia and tramp your way to Piha in two days. Great adventure!

Fastest hitch ever! We were like let's try here. Our thumb was not even fully in the air yet when one of the many cars already stopped to give us a ride. Amazing spot! Plus next to a 4 square supermarket in case you get hungry.
Great spot! Just not much around if you have to wait for a long period of time.
Most reliable spot to hitch out of Timaru south. Long wide road with plenty of space for cars to pull over (assuming their are none parked)
Nice parking next to it where people can stop.
Good spot going east to wards bulls. Big truckstop with a ton of space to pull over, good visibility and speed.
Tiny gravel road in the middle of nowhere. Basically zero cars, but the first one stopped!

Outside the school there is a parking area which is safe to stop, So long as the school is not busy, if it is go further up near the cemetery. But this was good as the crossroads slow the traffic and visibility is good.

30 minute wait and a gisbourne sign got a ride direct to gisbourne through the beautiful gorge route!

One minute wait time, ride straight to opotiki, good pull over spot, slowish traffic. Bus here from tauranga was 3.4nzd.

I had wanted to hitch from Tauranga, however the all the Eastbound spots seemed crap due to the big road. Happily the road is a toll road, and a lot of long distance traffic goes through te puke as it is free, which is a smaller, more hitchable road.

Got a bus here from tauranga, costing 3.4nzd with student discount (didn't ask for I'd, paid in cash, bus leaves from bayf
Busy road but safe on the sidewalk. Road is wide enough for a car to stop. Some nice shade to. Great to go north.

Very safe spot, very large space for the cars to stop. The first car picked me up but if the wait is too long, there's a small store in front. No shade.
Medium traffic (1 car every minute)
Nice spot, right after the café. Lots of space for the cars to stop. Very busy road but safe on the sidewalk. Waited max 10 mins
Best spot to get a direct lift to chch. All cars driving northwest from Wanaka will pass here
Great spot to go in any direction. Plenty of traffic and space for cars to stop there.
Great spot since many travelers stop for the pies. Easy to ask for a ride to mount Arthur.
Anywhere along here is a good place- lots of cars and the side of road thats for parking is empty, so easy for people to pull over
Took me all the way south to Wellington. Ask people at the station where they’re going
Country folk very willing to pick up a traveler. Wait by the restrooms (they are free and public)
Give cars space to pull over in the paved section next to the train tracks
Ask around at the gas station

first car picked me up everywhere on the island. best way to get around.
Allthough little traffic before 7am
just after the Z station before the speed limit changes to 100 lots of space for cars to pull over ! get yourself a pie while you’re at it. Omnomnom.
BEST spot if you want to go to Hobbiton, most of the cars going on this road are heading to Hobbiton
On my way to Hobbiton, someone took me on this street and drop me a the intersection of the roads

Nice spot: cars slow down at the roundabout, plenty of space to stop on the side of the road, next to a petrol station, and last but not least plenty of shade! Ideal if you're headed north on the State Highway 1
Enough room for cars to stop. A lot of traffic here
Lot of space for cars to stop, cars not going too fast

Ended up in Geraldine by accident so was bit worried about getting out. Stood here for 10 mins and got ride to Timaru. 50km zone cars going slow space to pull over and country ass town. What was I worried about !
Lots of space for cars to pull over. I stood on the road not the footpath.
Great spot for going to Rotorua, you can get there with local bus 38. It goes at 12:15 from the Taupō Visitor centre
Very good spot for hitching both ways, right beside the park, plenty of space for cars to pull-up. Toilets nearby.
Good spot for hitching north to Queenstown/Wanaka
Great spot for hitching to Christchurch. You can get local bus 1 from Dunedin here. There’s plenty of space for cars to stop. You are guaranteed getting a direct ride to ChCh

If you are going north from ChCh to Kaikoura/Picton but your ride is going to Hammer Springs get out here to continue hitching north. Great spot, with heaps of place to pull up, toilets and shops nearby.
If it’s raining you can take a local bus to Tauranga for 5 dollars. One goes at 7:20 (102) and the other at 17:05 (105)
You can hitch to Whitianga pretty much anywhere in Taurus. Just go along the road and you’ll get ride in no time
Great spot for going north to Taupo/Tongariro. In front of the BP station, plenty of space for cars to pull up, great visibility. 10/10
Big spot for cars to stop. Cars go slow.
Wide shoulder, slow traffic.
Slow traffic after roundabout, lots of space to stop.
Cars drive slowly uphill, there is a lot of space to pull over.
Enough place for cars to stop, slow traffic. If there is no good place closer to roundabout, that's your spot.
Slow driving cars after roundabout. There is a place to stop for cars behind entrance to some sport center.

Nice wide shoulder, near a roundabout so the cars are going slow. Hitch from underneath the 100km speed sign. 6.5/10 visibility though, because drivers are just coming out of a turn. Still works great. Hard to reach though, requires some walking.
Accessible by bus (11 line). Enough place for cars to stop and a lot of traffic. Safe sport. Good spot to go in the South (Taupo). Maybe for the north too?
little bit low traffic, but somebody is gonna stop!!:)
starting hitching form bus stop with no success moved to new spot, recommend by a local. Just past the bus stop directly underneath the green sign to raglan.
At firs i tried it more in the center of hamilton. Didn't work for me. If you want ti go to raglan it's better to go a bit away from the center.
Very quickly found a ride from here to Cromwell, big space to pull over and fairly slow traffic.
Lots of traffic, plenty of space to pull over. Found a lift only to Sanson junction, heading south on Route 1. I imagine with a "Wellington" sign you could find a direct lift fairly quickly.
Very friendly people! Not waiting
near the honda dealership. outbound spot
east side of town heading north.
Worth the walk outta town for this one. Easy spot for cars to pull over.
Close to the YHA, slow speed limits, nice scenery
Slowish traffic and heading in the right direction.  Didn't take long to get a ride.
Excellent spot to head to start a journey to the west coast or Christchurch direction (or just Albert Town/Hawea)

Excellent spot to hitch to Treble Cone in the winter and Mt Aspiring.  Showed up here on a powder day once and there were already 10+ people waiting.  But we were all in cars on the way to the mountain within 15 mins!
If you get stuck out here, no worries, tones of space and cars can see you from far

Good spot with plenty of slow flowing traffic from the bridge, shady spot handy to the shops with good space to pull over- excellent for those wishing to head towards hamilton. Should be good for people heading in opposite direction but might pay to try from different spaces so that it's clear where you're hoping to go (ie. direction auckland, coromandel, waihi etc)
sweet spot when travelling south towards Ngunguru! Short wait and plenty of cars, good visibility and open bay area for cars to pull over
Sweet spot for heading both north or south along the tutukaka coast- good traffic flow in summer with lots o' people pulling over to pick up groceries and chippies!
excellent spot on the on-ramp headed south- plenty of traffic passes this point, would recommend to everyone wishing to travel south outta aux- pays to have a sign

Good hitching going north (on the northern side) from here as i found that the extended low speed zone with reasonable through traffic made it easy to get a ride. Took me three mins to get a car to Christchurch from here.
Great spot foe those of you wishing to head north or south, planty of slow flow traffic when I was here, wide road with plenty of space, nice locals. 20 minute wait

decent spot for sussing a ride to fox glacier, most of the people at the franz josef glacier usually head straight out from here to their next destination- so it was really easy hitching back from the carpark
excellent spot for those of you wishing to leave Queenstown. Plenty of space for cars to  pull over, good visibility, slow flow, managed to get a ride within 20 minutes
great spot if you're trying to get out of town and make your way towards wanaka, queenstown or invcargal. There is a service station and an area for trucks and larger vehicles to pull over.

decent spot, slower traffic flow! Wide road, parking spaces on either side so perfect for travelling south and good for those headed north. I waited 30 mins, started strolling down road with pack and got a ride in no time!
great spot for hitching a ride south. 5 minutes and I had a ride down to temuka..
nice open spot near shops and city center. Lots of room for drivers to pull over. 20 minute wait last time!
Excellent spot- have used on multiple occasions and it never takes more then 30 minutes to thumb down a ride- plenty of room for cars to pull over and little local traffic (best for heading south)
good spot behind the bridge before speed limit if you want to get north
good spot for being picked up. most people go all the way to christchurch
get out of the car and hitch to lincoln if you want to get south. avoid Christchurch
good place
many tourists drive up to Milford Sound from here
most people go to the glacier and then further down south. dont try hitching out of town. got a lift to queenstown from here
just wait next to the last carpark
good one in front of Kfc towards Auckland
Bored of hiking down 90 miles beach? at low tide there should be enough people taking you down to Ahipara. Best part of the beach is north of the Bluff so you won't miss anything
10 min walk from ferry terminal to here. Plenty of room for car to see you and pull over.
getting out of Wellington on Route SH1. take the train from Wellington station to Paraparaumu which costs about $6.50, 55 minutes.
This is a great place for traveling south, got a ride from here to Wellington.
This place is great for getting to Gisborne or Napier. Choice for swimming too.
This is great as long as there's some traffic.

Top of the hill, right after the petrol station is the best spot. Lots of cars going North. People were very friendly showing me the best spot too. Great spots along the route too, but people don't like stopping too much after having pulled back up on the road so the petrol station is best
Good spots all along here, best place is at the top of the hill (for heading north)! 30 minutes and you should certainly have a ride
Perfect spot to hitch to christchurch. Lots of tourist coming from kaikoura whale whatching, going back to christchurch.

For going south. Easy to get a single ride all the way to Christchurch. Expect bus loads of tourists going to look at whales to pass and point at you like you are the first sighting on their whale watching tour.

I hitchhiked at this spot twice (once on my way to the west coast and once on my way back). I also picked up two hitchhikers here once when I was driving to the west coast. The spot is great as there is plenty of space to stop, and most people will do this anyway to visit the Pass. There are two cafes + a doc campground right in the area.
Plenty of room to pull over. Any traffic coming from west coast/the pass will pass you
best spot for heading north
This place is good for traveling north.
Quiet spot, but it was easy to get a ride to Aussie Bay campsite from here after getting off the ferry
few traffic but awesome road. find sb on the ferry going this way!
Typical motorway servo/rest area. Good for going south
once you get to here you should find it very to get a ride south. many people are stopping here before driving long distances.
Better than uber. Thumb out and the first car took me all the way to wanaka
Fairly good place to get you out of town (direction frankton) Certainly not the best place for drivers to pull over but I managed quite alright and the driver could pull over safely
Great spot for going up north to Taupo, cars going slow, plenty of space to pull up, dairy and toilets nerarby
Great spot for going up north to Taupo, cars going slow, plenty of space to pull up, dairy and toilets nerarby

Got a lift from a local railway worker. He travels from Welly to Palm every day, so there's a chance he'll pick you up in the afternoon. Other than that, this is a pretty rough place for cars to stop. there is a place to stop as they accelerate just before the ramp onto a motorway.
This is the spot listed for hitch hiking out of Wellington, good spot. Tried it recently 24.06.2016 and got a lift within minutes to Taupo.
There is a place for cars to pull up, got a ride to taupo in 10 minutes
Confirmed, got ride at night after 20 min to Taupo. There is a place to pull over.
Good place if you're looking for a ride north, 25 minutes before I sussed a ride to Taupo
It was not the best spot because everyone was heading to the north. But we've been picked up (two girls) in 30mn by a german solo traveller. Families and tourists in vans usually don't stop.
During low season is hard, nearly no cars and most of them packed. Fortunately I didn’t share the same fate as the infamous left stranded hitchhiker.

Punakaiki is famous for bieng where that German hotchiker got stranded for 3 days, went berserk, vandalised road signs, then got arrested. 

What the hell he was doing wrong I don't know, literally the first car stopped and took me to the next city. 1 minutes wait time. Germans eh?
hard to get out, many full cars with tourist. very many hitchhikers
Most traffic is going to Qtown direction in the a.m, but easy enough spot to get to Alberttown/Hawea
Best spot for getting out of Wanaka. You can get a ride from fellow backpackers to get here or worst case scenario walk 2/3km.
Easy spot to get to at least Albert Town/Hawea or beyond.
Two girls headed to pororari river. We've been taken in 3 minutes. Really good spot where cars can stoped before taking the main road.
Okayish spot when heading north. Got a ride to Punakaiki, where I was left stranded for 4 hours.
Excellent spot, lots of local traffic in the morning! Got a ride to next town no sweat- good for people headed north
Seems terrible but got picked up quitte fast. Plenty of space for the car to stop and pick you up. Busy roundabout.
Great spot! Really good for heading up north.. Short wait, open space, good area for cars to pull over
Not perfect for cartes to stop but effecient enough.
small on-ramp with little parking bay. Fairly good spot given the proximity of  the carpark. Good for heading north!
Great spot to leave Auckland (south or east way)

Decent spot for heading south towards Hamilton/Wellington. Lots of space to pull over. Found a ride to Hamilton after 20-30 minutes - most traffic is going straight under the motorway on the 22 but decent amount of cars going south on the 1.
Waited quite a bit here, since most cars weren't going far. I took a ride to a pie shop in Sheffield and met many other travelers there that took me all the way to mount Arthur.
very good place for getting to mt arthur
Most cars are turning into Hawea, so less traffic. But can still catch someone coming from Wanaka or turning from Hawea easy enough
Got dropped here when going north. There is a small bay right before the turn to Hawea. Heaps of cars will be turning there so don’t get discouraged. Not ideal spot
for going north. i've used it four times and each time i got a ride within ten minutes. have a sign to say which highway you want so it's not confusing.
Not a lot of traffic later in the day, but we got a ride to the Bendigo freedom camping site just up the road easy enough
Good turn off spot for cars. Nice scenery.  Go for a quick fish if you dont have luck with a life.
If you are heading to Paradise/Kinloch or begging of the Routeburn track this is your bet shot.

Probably the best spot to hitch from when wanting to get ouf of town- I made the mistake of heading off on a sunday so there was very very little traffic but one of the first few drivers I came across was driving straight through to queenstown.
Fast traffic, not a very good amount of space for drivers to stop but we found a lift in maybe 5-10 minutes towards Alexandra.
Not the best pull off, but managed a lift quickly from here a couple times.
Wait short behind curve, a lot of space at the shoulder
Got dropped off there. Safest place to hitch a ride if you want to go north. Not a lot of cars (1 every 2 mins).
Decent spot, enough room to pull over, out the front of the local store.

Good spot, easy to stop, lots of space, also a gas station. Not too much traffic but enough for hitchhiking. First ride I was unsure about, so be careful who offers. Managed to hitch first half to Turangi, then got a ride to Taupo.
Good spot to head north, room to pull over, got a ride in 5
Good spot as there is plenty of traffic going by and a place to stop for a car heading west.
Good amount of traffic and decent place to pull over. Can't complain
Not a bad spot but also no traffic
Spot might not be exact but there's a few places along the road for people to pull off. Lots of traffic
A bit confusing because of the turn off. Not a lot of space after the turn either. Best is to stop by the cafe before coming over and chat w some people doing a rest break!
Good spot if you are coming back from Mavora Lake, cars have time to see you and stop.
Cars come fast but have enough room to pull off. Didn't take long to get a ride
So so traffic, kind of comes around a curve but slow enough to see ya. Has some room to pull over but lots of locals also pulling into the store
Decent amount of traffic flow. About 50/50 for cars turning south vs north
Not as much traffic in the morning coming from Mt. Cook, but easier to get picked up than across the road (high speed, blind curve, little shoulder there)
Lots of cars and space for them to stop. Only issue is that it's also right next to a deep ditch
Shoulder space for cars to stop here. Got a lift to Christchurch fairly quickly from here
Easy spot with plenty of cars, slow traffic and space for cars to pull up.
Space for cars to stop just after the round about
There is room to stop just in front of the cas station
Perfect spot if you cross the road with someone going north !!
Got dropped here by a local while hitching north. There is a small shed that can provide cover from rain and a place to pull up for cars going north.
Long wait, not many cars going north from Westport to Karamea. On the most of the road north from the town there is place to pull up

There’s a spot right beside the blue sign if you are heading north. I was hitching late ~4pm and had to stay a night in backpackers, next day waited in rain 1,5 hours and got a ride to Greymouth. Low season can be really tough here

If you get dropped at the lake Parangi campsite and you are hitching north your best bet is to walk a couple hundred meters to the ¿abandoned? motel. Right in front of it there is a spacious bay for cars to pull-up. There isn’t a lot of traffic so keep it in mind and don’t get caught by the night!
Not much traffic on west coast in low season. There is a place to pull up in short distance from the something stag restaurant. Good spot for going north
Good spot for hitching to Wanaka/Cromwell. Easily accessible by a local bus, there is a small bay right after the turn to arrowtown.
Pretty much anybody going from here will be heading to Glenorchy/Queenstown
Very good spot for hitching to Glenorchy, just a walk from the last stop of the bus 1
Good spot for going south to Dunedin. Got picked up by students in no time (you’ll get bonus points for writing “Dunners” on your sign instead of Dunedin)

Very good spot for getting out of Dunedin to Queenstown. Take a local bus to Caversham shops. From there walk south along South St, just before you get to the motorway lights cross the road and walk on the right hand side of Caversham Place (a small dead end street with residental houses on one side). Just before the end of the street walk accross the grass to the right to get to the motorway and walk a little way up the motorway about 20m to where there is an extra lane. The extra lane 30 metre
Very good spot for going north, opposite to church. You can go here from ChCh with a local bus

On the motorway, there is a wide shoulder, though cars go fast. 
At the motorway entrance, there isn't much traffic. 
I went to the next entrance, a roundabout, where cars go much slower. However, the shoulder is narrower, plus traffic to Napier turns east earlier.
Enough place to stop, cars go still quite slow. Good visibility, nice traffic
There is an area to pull over so cars can pick you, that’s the only to get to invercargill from Baclutha

Got a lift super quick in the direction of Cromwell, but only as far as Luggate. Driver explained that maybe 30% of traffic from here was going to Cromwell/Alexandra, but from Luggate about 90% of traffic is going that way. The spot itself is ok with a little road entrance for drivers to pull over. We walked to this spot as there was roadworks at the 84/6 junction.

Not the busiest of roads after the road splits into the 6/65 but nice amount of room to pull over and traffic not too fast after the corner. We found a ride in 15 minutes heading to Greymouth, but the gentleman was heading to Franz Josef.

Fair amount of traffic heading south on the 6. Maybe you'll go a few minutes without seeing a car but then there will be a load all at once. We found a lift to just beyond Murchison within 15 minutes but the gentleman was travelling to Christchurch. Plenty of room to pull over.
Slow traffic, room to pull over. Heading south on Route 1, we waited about 15 minutes for a lift to Bulls.

Nice spot by the historic railway bridge and the big carrot. Plenty of space, slow enough traffic. Found a lift heading south on Route 1 from here after about 15 minutes. "North" or "South" sign recommended here if you want to catch a lift going further on the 1.

Plenty of traffic, albeit quite fast. Not the best space for a car to pull over but there is a tiny layby just before the road distances sign. Waited 5 minutes for a lift to Taupō. 4/5 only because of traffic speed and pullover space.

Pretty decent spot for heading south out of Hamilton, we only got a lift to Cambridge but I'm sure you can get a lift much further out to Taupō or Rotorua. Plenty of space for cars to pull over and the traffic isn't too fast.

Enough space for someone to pull over. After the turning for Whakapapa Village so you miss anyone not going south, but catch anyone coming from there. It's before the 100kph sign so they're not necessarily going fast either. People pulling into the fuel station also have a chance to see you
decent space for cars to pull over and cars do not have to much speed.
Good spot. Probably the best in this direction, but very far outside.

We had to wait about 5mins until a nice man took us nearly to Whitianga than.
Many cars and plenty space to stop there ...
good intersection. we headed north, got a quick ride to wairoa.
Right at Greenlane Train station and the Ellerslie Sunday Car Market. Easy to stop at side street, and at a traffic light.
Good place, lots of characters living nearby, happy to give lifts
Good for heading south
Okay for heading south or west.
Average to good, outside of the shop. Awkward pullover but cars go slow.
Good one to get toward Kerikeri  or north
Easy enough to head north from this area of town
Can get here on the local buses to the mall and then walk a bit.  Worth it, this is a good spot.
Easy enough just after the roundabout. Cars are going fairly slow.
Decent enough for heading Wanaka/QT way.
Not heaps of traffic, but all vacationers/travellers. Eventually you'll find some nice person to give you a lift.
Average to good.  Typical small town, low speed limits, ample room to pull over
Found a shop with an awning at the end of the strip. Good visibility, low speed limits, and cover if it starts to rain
Small pullover a little way after the bridge. Decent enough traffic flow
Decent enough spot to get outta this hole of a town.
Nice spot for people to pull over, people at the store can see you to consider you're worthiness before getting back on the road (remember to smile a lot !)
Only a small pullout and high speed limit, but still managed a ride fairly quick
Last leg into Wanaka from a long day from Chch perhaps.  Not too bad of a spot.
Awkward spot but enough space for cars turning to go over crown range to stop.  Fairly easy to get a lift from here to Wanaka
Not the easiest spot for cars to pull over but the friendly locals will still go out of their way to stop.
Decent enough spot by the campground if you get a local ride just to Albert Town.
I wouldn't say it's the best spot (not so much room to stop), but if you're heading west (Piha in my case) I'd give it a try. It took me less than 10 minutes to get a lift.
Space, slow speed, and Happy Hitching!
Going North: speeds still slow, and lots of space and visibility. A sign may help, as many are only going short distances.

Going North, there's a drive-way for cars to stop. It's right before the speed goes up to 100, so cars begin to speed up. Otherwise, go back to the beginning of the bridge, but then you only have cars from one source. Here, you also get them from Famdon Rd and SH2
Space to stop, and cars are slow off the Round-about
brilliant spot for travellers wishing to head south- safe for drivers to pull over, can spot on coming cars from a distance!

decent spot for people heading north out of Narrows- I managed to thumb down a ride to Onehunga within 30 minutes- best time to hitch is when people are heading to work as it seems common for them to commute to Auckland
ideal spot for people heading to hamilton, wide road with HEAPS of space for people to pull over, fair amount of traffic- there's bound to be other decent spots for getting out of town
seemingly open area with good visibility- enough room for cars to pull over comfortably but cars are going fairly quickly.
sweet little shady tar-sealed area where you can get rides south quite easily- good visibility! was waiting for all of 15 minutes

Fairly good spot, reasonable space for pulling over- traffic stops and goes due to lights.
Nice crowd passes through here
very good spot right before the roundabout- wasn't long before I got a ride heading north through to Auckland.
Sweet spot for rides both north and south. Good straight road, plenty of cars pass through during the week
Fairly good place to catch traffic just before it leaves town and probaly the last spot before the roads become nasty and windy. There are few places to pul over for the next 90 kms
Really easy to make your way up to Wanganui or to get a ride up north along the no.1
Great place to get a ride east, not particularly sheltered though! I was outta here within 30 minutes of arrival
good spot to catch traffic headed north but I had a long wait here and ended up finding a ride by sparking up a conversation with someone at foursquare..
relatively good spot- you get a fair amount of traffic and the vast majority heads straight through to GY
small parking bay with little park , nice sheltered with plenty of traffic heading in both directions (ideal for travelling south from otaki)
takes a while but people are driving far here
to the east cape
few traffic. good anyway
good for any direction
if you want to hitch further east, come here or at the yha and dont try out of town. most people coming from south travel to Coromandel town

Take bus B to Belfast and ask for the last stop in Belfast. 
Cars go fast here but their is hips of traffic. You could also walk back to the red light where people can have a better look at you.
If you bother walking about 2-3km from Wanaka, this is the best place getting south or northwest. Arrive early to avoid competing with other hitchhikers!
Good place to hitch, plenty of room for cars to stop

Despite being a meeting place of two highways Woodville has very little traffic. But what few cars there are will stop. Also, Woodville can be worth a short stop on its own due to the many antique/curio/secondhand stores here.
North end of town before speed change. Got a ride within 10 mins to Dunedin.
Good spot with room for cars to pull over before speed changes out of town.

to hitch south to motueka, nelson, westcoast.
although the speedlimit is already 100 it's maybe a better spot then in town, cause car can see you from quite far and there's a lot of place to pull over. just follow the road south from takaka and after 5 minutes walk you're there.
happy hitching
If you want a spot walkingdistance from city centre to go north. Took 5 minutes before a car gave me a lift, across the bridge.
On SH 73 just west of Yaldhurst Road. Good safe area for cars to stop just before start of 100kmh.
50 km speed limit, plenty of space.

Small parkspace, slow traffic... Takes you to Queenstown.
You will drive the highest road in NZ.
Lots of tourists. Make sure you try hitchhiking out when boats arrive.
This is a motorway on ramp - best place for leaving the city canter. I've used a few times, 5-15 mins max wait time.
If there's traffic this stop will work well for traveling north.
This is good for traveling both north and south.
Got a ride from the 2nd car that came through. Good amount of traffic as well. Only got down to Hokitika but easy enough to hitch out of there as well
Pretty bad for going south. Took us 3h to get picked up, and we were only got as far as Hokitika
Nice spot to hitch, lots of traffic (heavily dependent on ferry schedule). Found a lift to Blenheim in just a couple of minutes.

Despite the constant flow of traffic and the ideal straight open road it was difficult to find a ride! After about an hour and a half I got a ride well beyond my destination (Kaikoura) to Lyttleton!!
I suspect the reason it took so long to get a ride may have been that the competition curekids was running saw 56 groups of hitchers make their way from Picton to Christchurch that morning!!
Fast traffic along a curve in the road.  Your best bet is cars turning from the MT Cook road heading south.
Easy enough to get to Mt Cook NP from here
Crazy sandflies, but easy enough spot to hitch a ride to the start of the Copland Track 50kms further down the road

Maybe about 10-15 minutes wait for us for a ride to Fox Glacier. Better than waiting in the village as there you will miss the traffic leaving the glacier road and heading south. Little bit of room to pull over but fairly slow traffic.
not the greatest spot… took a couple hours on the far side of the bridge heading south, but the bugs can be bruuuutaaaallll
Tried to go North. Not much place to stop for cars. I went to next entrance on the North.
Waited about 2 mins
Not the best - Lots of traffic but waited for over an hour to get to Warkworth, very little space to park.
I haven't used to place, but am a local and I'm sure it would work well.

Walking up to taranaki. I started thumbing from the junction, but for some reason the tourists really didn't get the spirit of hitchiking and refused to pick me up, even though they all had space and where all going where I was going. This really sucked in the furious summer heat, and I guess given I was in a national park surrounded by what I thought was open minded adventurous people I had heightened hopes.

After walking ages a kind tourist eventually stopped and I had a great time. Guess t
Middle of knowhere on a road going to the middle of knowhere. I walked up the road and pretty quickly found a functional spot and got a ride to the lost world highway.
You need to be lucky tough. On another day we had to wait for an hour or so. But eventually you will most likely find a hitch.
Not really a spot at all, just got dropped there by a local.

Not the best place since people will have to pull over in the turn lane and right after it turns into high speed, but might be best option to catch as much traffic as possible going north towards Gore
Ask cars stopped at the light headed south
Not a lot of traffic and most of it is going to the glacier and then further south. Might be better to get to the glacier parking and then hitch, but you'll still find someone going straight through
Two men. Lots of room to pull up, good visibility, close to amenities.

There is a small space for cars to stop on the turning lane to drive in to the camp ground, but unfortunately cars go 100kms/h here and it's difficult for cars to stop. It is possible though and we got a ride to Timaru from here after an hour wait. Otherwise get up early before everyone leaves the camp ground and ask around for a lift

Sandflies!!!!
You can catch a ride with hikers returning from Welcome Flat, or thumb it on the road. There's a small space for cars to stop
Easy spot to get a ride to Wanaka. Space for cars to stop at the gas station exit

I stood at the end of the busstop, giving cars space to pull over in the bus lane. Good spot because just after traffic lights so cars got time to see you and not going too fast yet. Was there quite early on Sunday morning and not much traffic which is why I waited so long.

Thought this spot would be dogs because 100kph zone, but there was lots of space to pull over so ended up being fine. I stood right underneath the sign on the corner so I was visible but away from the road ! Got ride to Dunedin in 5 mins.
Okayish spot for getting to Blenheim/Picton. You can get there with a local bus
Since I didn’t get any rides in Marahui to Motueka I just kept on walking down this road. At the marked spot there is a place for cars to pull up, got my ride there.

You can get here with local bus (80) from Tauranga. There is place for cars to pull up right in front of the I-site. It’s not ideal though since there are cars parking and a bus stop. Recommend hitching to coromandel from Waihi (you can take bus 85 there) or Bethlehem

Tiny ass dirt road in the middle of the wop wops. Literally nobody here (like one car per day) but got picked up eventually. If you want to get to the doc trails and huts, this is the road, the one to the south over the river goes only to private property, even if it has more cars.
A roundabout, where cars go quite slow. However, the shoulder is a bit narrow. On a good note traffic to Napier turns east earlier.
The best spot in area. Cars can pull over to the parking. Though still not great.
Very few people use the road, so thumb every car, but eventually got picked up and driven out of here. Slow, but possible.

Typically longer waiting time anywhere along this road. Not too much traffic, and very full cars/2-seat vans. We hitched from here after camping at the Parangi DOC ground and we found a ride towards Wanaka after 45 minutes. 3/5 because the 6 is fairly quiet but you should find a lift and there is lots of room to stop on either side.

We walked here from Fox Glacier village. Careful crossing the bridge (single file and no footpath). Not the best spot and fair walk to get there. Driver ended up pulling over on the other side of the road. Better than hitching in town as you miss a lot of the glacier traffic, much like in Franz Josef. Lift was going to Wanaka, however.

Fair amount of traffic, and room to pull over. However, traffic was quite fast and cars were packed out on this tourist road. After 60 minutes we managed to get a lift to Franz Josef on a rainy morning.

Fairly long wait heading to Hokitika, but worth mentioning this was around 2 hours before sunset and we were still well and truly within Greymouth where a lot of traffic was clearly just travelling locally. We eventually found a ride from a fella heading to Christchurch, and we rode with him to Kumara junction just 16km south on the 6. I imagine this spot is a lot better earlier in the day. Use of a sign recommended.

Plenty of traffic, but we waited a little while before getting a lift out of town. Most traffic heading further will be heading north towards Havelock/Nelson after Renwick, and a lot of the ferry traffic heading that way likely takes the 62 bypassing Blenheim.

Odd spot to be hitching, but we were dropped off here as our last ride was heading east on the Vinegar Hill Rd. Ample space to pullover as cars come round the corner and up the hill. Lorry driver pulled over to offer one of us a ride to Wellington without realising there was two. Found a lift to the next village (Hunterville) after 20 minutes where traffic speeds were slower.

We experienced a fairly long wait time here. There was a fair amount of traffic, for a relatively quiet road, as well as space to pull over (albeit a bit short). We were here at 8AM and it was raining pretty heavily. We went to the petrol station to put some extra layers on and without even attempting to hitch we were told by the staff there that we were not allowed to solicit rides on their property. Found a lift to Ohakune after 90 minutes or so, as we decided our best bet to get to Wellington

Very, very quiet road - as expected. However, giving it 3/5 as it is possible to hitch this road into the national park, (or to National Park town). 45 minute wait or so and we found a ride to National Park.

Perhaps it was the time of day (one hour or so before sunset), but we struggled to find a ride south on Route 1. It was only after about one hour that a nice local lady took us to Tūrangi. 3/5 because maybe this spot is great in the day time when folks are travelling further. Plenty of space to pull over and relatively slow traffic.
Long straight road with a wide shoulder cars to stop. Fast traffic speeds and not too many cars. Found a lift to Tokoroa within 15 minutes.

Probably better to go a bit down the road to the other spot, but roadworks forced me to find a different place to hitch a ride. Pretty decent area. Lots of cars, but two directions so a sign would make it easier for people to gauge when to stop. You're visible from the entire roundabout, two Kiwis came from the other way and turned around to give me a lift. Good a place as any, definitely gets you hitched

Bad place to hitch hike even though it's on the highway...!
Waited something like two or three hours to get picked up by lovely Canadian people!
little maori town on SH2.
2 guys headed for east coast. stood for an hour. lots of traffic.
Slow speed limits, but sometimes parked cars block the view
Not much traffic.
Outside a prison. Not the best place to hitch! But I still managed fairly quick, just put my backpackout front, made a friendly Wellington sign and smiled!
High speed limits pretty average.  But someone will stop.  The guy that did used to hitch and was stoked to give me a ride
High speed limits, not much traffic.  But eventually someone will stop
Pit stopped for the Moeraki Boulders.  Glad I did, they are pr.etty cool.  Not the best of spots because of low visibility and high speed limits, but still didn't wait terribly long
Average spot, but it works!
Average spot.  Good visibility but not uch traffic.  However, got one of the more fascinating rides of my life with an Egyptian fellow who was building dairy sheds in the middle of nowhere.
Cars have to slow down, locals seem mixed on whether they want to pick you up.

(the dot on the map has to be on the other side of the road) 
Lots of place for them to stop but it's better to wait further north after road 1 and 73 merge, for going north.
Very few spaces along this road, but here's one. Curvy road, but speeds are slow.
its alright. not much traffic between invacargill and bluff, but you should get a ride in not too much time.
i waited 3 or 4 hours for a ride heading south. make sure you find the best spot, if you walk to far out of town the road gets curvy and not great for stopping.
pretty bad. walked all the way through blenheim till i got the the farms. waited a few hours. bring a longboard for the walk out of town...
average. waited a couple hours heading south

Punakaike, right at the top on the opposite side of the road to the restaurant there is a big parking area which the busses use. Plenty of tourists passing by in either direction but had no luck with them- instead, it was an older kiwi bloke who gave me a ride after an hour or so waiting

pretty poor spot to get caught out at! There was plenty of traffic but there is a big blind corner limited space for drivers to stop and they are usually pacing it here. Having said that, I was able to get a ride from here within 45 minutes

80km zone to 100km, nice wide road, good road as all traffic is headed south along the main drag. Despite this fact i ended up waiting an awefully long time in Ashburton, I wandered back along the road towards the town centre and had a ride within 10 minutes of reaching the 50km sign
Pretty poor spot ! Some kind soul picked me up and brought me to the edge of town.
when you came from mt fyffe and want to go down south cross the river here. not possible in spring
hitched here for getting to mt arthur faster. in fact it might be faster taking the highway via rolleston
if you want to go to akaroa, take the bus to halswell and try hitching here
you might be lucky and find sb here going down the tourist drive at the coast. takes time
for hitching to the mt aspiring carpark. possible, but bring time !
very few traffic. first car should take you, but that might take a while
had better luck here going south than on the highway
just wait for the first car
if you want to get to the waterfalls try hitching here. there is very few traffic on old te arahoa road !!!
totally frusted of hitching out of Auckland? come here by train and hitch towards the coast
waited for 2hours. incredible unlucky, its a perfect spot and very much traffic
Traffic lights and plenty of traffic. Some room to stop but not perfect. A lot of traffic is going South. It may be helpful sign saying "Bombay gas station"

good spot to hitch north to picton, cars are still slow and heaps of space for the cars to pull over. probably not that good when a lot of people are tryin to hitch from a bit south in the city, cause they maybe get picked up first. 
directions: just cross the bridge and you'll see the spot, it's obvious
This is useable for getting south

Me and my friend (both men) started off at Bulli pt and ventured to the starting point until a taxi driver came and stopped. He was commuting to Welly and offered a free lift. Got there in 5 hr with a lunch break

Terrible place if you're heading south. Got dropped off here on the way to Wellington from Auckland, while it is possible to get here southbound on SH1, almost everyone is heading north. I was there around 4 hours, was getting ready to give up, change my sign to Auckland and then fly from Auckland but absolutely lucked out with an awesome ride to Taupo area, and her son was heading to Wellington that evening so he ended up taking me, so it all worked out. 

Nowhere good to stand though, no roo
Two men. The middle of nowhere, no cover from the elements. Good visibility and lots of room to stop at least. There's a bus line that stops close-ish to the spot.

Bad spot, I got dropped at Rae’s Junction. If you are going north there a great spot right in front of the Rae’s Junction hotel if heading south then well the only spot is a slow vehicles bay around 650m from the junction itself. I got a ride to Dunedin though.
Not ideal spot. Got dropped off from a ride from Wanaka.
Almost no traffic, most of the cars go on free road through Te Puke.

I stood at the split between the exit and the motorway on the concrete section, trying to head north. There is a fairly wide shoulder for cars to pull over. Cars were going fast. Although the police saw me, they didn’t do anything, even though it's still a motorway with "no pedestrian" signs. I can't really recommend, but the place "works".

Heading south on the 6, we thought we'd try our luck for a while hitching from outside the church. There wasn't really much traffic at all and most signalled to us that they were turning left up to the glacier. Better off walking to the other side of the bridge and hitching after the glacier junction. 2/5 as it is definitely still possible to catch a ride going further south.

Heading towards St Arnaud, we walked up and down this road searching for ample space for cars to stop - only the odd junction to a farm or yard. It is possible to hitch this road to St Arnaud, but most cars are only travelling to local vineyards. The nice fella that eventually took us to St Arnaud had to turn around further up and come back round for us. Be prepared for a long wait with no shade on a sunny day. Bring lots of water!

Access to Lake Monowai and Borland Road. Little traffic even in main season, though fishing/hiking and DOC campground at Lake Monowai and Borland Lodge get some people in and out. But more importantly, SH99 sees very little traffic, be prepared for just 10 cars/hour even in main tourist season.
Bad spot because of no spot to pull over.  If you're easly enough in the morning and the parking spots are empty it can be okay though
Tried to take SH 85 back toward Wanaka.  Gave up due to puzzled looks and minimal traffic (all old pensioner looking people)
Small smal town.  Waited a long time but eventually got a ride into Oamaru
waited here to go north until a policeman stopped and told me noone would probably stop there so he took me a bit further to a better spot.
No space, and cars are fast. Walk North past bridge and walk with thumb out and maybe you'll get lucky, cuz the next good space is quite far up the road

not very good. walked/ boarded for quite a whiles till i finally finally got a ride. i was so tired from walking most the day and not sleeping night before i missed several cars cause i was passed out. got a ride all the way to grey mouth though...

While this place ought to be great for hitching towards picton I had a REALLy long wait and ended up walking several kilometers down the road before finding somone will to bring me to the local store ()at spring creek. I do not recommend this spot
possible to get to mt fyffe carpark from here. walk there, try to hitch, dont wait!
very few traffic. better hitching via intersection sh1/sh7
nice road but very hard to hitch
horrible city for hitching. spread out, long walking distances to find good places. take the bus
few traffic but possible
full of bees. be lucky!!
horrible. just trucks rushing by
few traffic. cars rush by. too much rain
leave with the ones you came. otherwise: good luck - there are days nobody is coming out here
gave up after trying to get down south for 30 mins
if you come from hot water try find sb there going your direction. cars just rush by here
cheap ferry and bus ticket to hot water beach available. doesnt make sense to hitch such a complicate route unless you find sb before

Lost world highway. Slow middle of knowhere road, but fairly pretty. Basically no cars, and when the one car per half an hour laughs at you and zooms past for no reason it kinda blows. Eventually got picked up and rode direct to Stratford. Don't pick this road if you need to get to taranaki fast. IT IS NOT A SHORTCUT.
Awful spot, nowhere to stand, nowhere to pull over, lots of local traffic. Nowhere really along this road to hitch. (East)
Terrible spot, waited 2 hours and moved spots
Just don't, anywhere along this road. Lots of places for cars to park, but they tend not to. Also bad in the school run hours since the cars are stationary at trafficlights

I was stuck here for 3 days. This is a stupid country. No rides whatsoever yet there was plenty of traffic. I am going back to France and never coming back. I do not regret destroying your street signs, I only regret not trying to destroy more. Do not mention New Zealand to me or I will fly into a rage.

Don't bother with this spot.
No space for cars to stop, plus cars can't see you, because of the turn.
Walked along the road, stuck my thumb out, got given a ride all the way to the road end where I could call. Super friendly locals. Easy!

If you're going to the west coast this road looks like an enticing shortcut vs going via Nelson. Indeed, someone used the exact words, "enticing shortcut" and took me from the perfect hitch spot outside the supermarket to here. 


5 hours later:
 
There was tons of traffic, they could see me, there was space to pull over. Nobody stopped. Nobody was going to the west coast this way, everyone is just going to work in the vineyards and farms a few miles down the road, and they won't help A hit

No luck - super quiet road, my guess is most of the cars we saw were only travelling short distances out of town. If you are trying to get to Tongariro National Park, just stick to Route 1 and head down to Tūrangi instead.
this is what you call low trafficked road ! good luck
very few traffic. you'll be better off taking the highways 73, 6 and 7. looks nice on the map but nobody driving here
organise your lift in one of the huts. you may be able to swap cars with sb walking the other way
nobody here
worst hitching road ever. just people going like 5kms. indeed in the end I hitched out the other way again and travelled via Richmond
Punakaiki. It's actually a little to the left. Some hostels here, but hard to hitch out of there.
